What does that have to do with the present time?

Well, we think that the analysis of this Court in Wilson was in large measure a historic analysis not totally, but in large measure a historic analysis as which would be the most appropriate statute to use.
Mr.... Mr. Schiff, it may work well in New York where it's easy enough, as you say, although I guess there's some contest on the point, to pick out what is the... the intentional tort statute.

--I... I think that... that when you try to take the word "intentional tort" and use that word "intent" and apply it in a constitutional context, you have two different words with two different meanings.

--In procedural due process, I don't think that that's the answer and I don't think it has been resolved in... in those two cases.
